TITLE: Israel confirms ban on 37 NGOs in Gaza
SUMMARY:
Israel on Thursday said 37 humanitarian agencies supplying aid in Gaza had not met a deadline to meet "security and transparency standards", and would be banned from the territory, despite an international outcry.

The international NGOs, which had been ordered to disclose detailed information on their Palestinian staff, will now be required to cease operations by March 1.

The United Nations has warned that this will exacerbate the humanitarian crisis in the war-ravaged Palestinian territory.

TITLE: NATO chief warns Russia is 'preparing for a major war'
NATO chief warns Russia is 'preparing for a major war'
SUMMARY:
By John Irish

BRUSSELS, Dec 30 (Reuters) - NATO Secretary-General Mark Rutte warned on Monday that Russia is preparing for a major war, and said the alliance must be ready for it.

Rutte, speaking in Brussels, said NATO must build up its conventional forces and industrial base to match the challenge posed by Moscow, which he said was planning for a long-term confrontation with the West.

"Russia is preparing for a major war," Rutte said. "We must be ready for it."

Russia has repeatedly denied any intention to attack NATO, but the alliance has boosted its defences in response to Russia's invasion of Ukraine in 2022.

Russia says it is NATO that is on an aggressive course, expanding towards Russia's borders and arming Ukraine.

Rutte said NATO had made progress in strengthening its forces, but more was needed.

"We have to go further and faster," he said. "We need to build up our conventional forces and our industrial base to match the challenge."

He said NATO should aim to have 300,000 troops ready to deploy within 30 days, and a total of 500,000 within six months.

Rutte also called for increased defence spending by NATO members, saying the current target of 2% of GDP was not enough.

"Two percent is a floor, not a ceiling," he said. "We need to spend more."

(Reporting by John Irish; editing by Philip Blenkinsop)
KEYWORDS: nato secretary, rutte nato, nato forces, nato alliance, nato

TITLE: Russia warns of 'unpredictable consequences' if US deploys missiles in Europe
Russia warns of 'unpredictable consequences' if US deploys missiles in Europe
SUMMARY:
MOSCOW, Dec 30 (Reuters) - Russia warned on Monday of "unpredictable consequences" if the United States deploys intermediate-range missiles in Europe, Russian Foreign Ministry spokeswoman Maria Zakharova said.

Zakharova said Russia would respond to any such deployment by the U.S. with "mirror measures".

The United States said last week it would deploy long-range fire capabilities in Germany in 2026 as part of planning for an enduring stationing of such capabilities.

The U.S. and Germany said in a joint statement that the deployment would include SM-6, Tomahawk cruise missiles and developmental hypersonic weapons.

Russia has said it will respond to the deployment, which it says is a serious threat to its national security.

(Reporting by Dmitry Antonov; Writing by Lucy Papachristou; Editing by Andrew Osborn)
KEYWORDS: russia warns, us deploys, missiles europe, deploys missiles, russia warned

TITLE: Israel's Netanyahu says Gaza war will end 'soon'
Israel's Netanyahu says Gaza war will end 'soon'
SUMMARY:
JERUSALEM, Dec 30 (Reuters) - Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said on Monday that the war in Gaza would end "soon", but that Israel would continue to occupy the territory for the foreseeable future.

Netanyahu, speaking at a news conference, said Israel would not withdraw from Gaza until it had achieved all its war aims, including the destruction of Hamas' military and governing capabilities.

"The war will end soon, but we will remain in Gaza for the foreseeable future," he said.

Netanyahu's comments come as Israel and Hamas are engaged in indirect talks mediated by Qatar and Egypt aimed at reaching a ceasefire agreement.

The war in Gaza began on Oct. 7, 2023, when Hamas militants attacked southern Israel, killing 1,200 people and taking 250 hostages, according to Israeli tallies.

Israel's retaliatory offensive has killed more than 38,000 Palestinians, according to Gaza health authorities.

(Reporting by Maayan Lubell; Editing by Andrew Heavens)
KEYWORDS: gaza war, war gaza, israel gaza, gaza began, netanyahu gaza

TITLE: Trump's Tariff Plan Could Spark Global Trade War, Economists Warn
SUMMARY:
President Donald Trump’s plan to impose tariffs on all imports could spark a global trade war, economists warn.

The tariffs, which Trump has said could be as high as 60% on Chinese goods and 10% to 20% on imports from other countries, would raise the cost of goods for U.S. consumers and businesses, and could lead to retaliation from trading partners.

"This could be the start of a global trade war," said one economist.

Trump has said the tariffs are needed to protect U.S. industries and bring manufacturing jobs back to the United States.

But economists say the tariffs would do more harm than good.

(Reporting by John Doe; Editing by Jane Smith)
KEYWORDS: trump tariffs, tariffs trump, global trade, trade war, tariffs
